71476: While celebrating her new apartment with her friends, a young woman suddenly and inexplicably leaps from the balcony, killing herself. Unconvinced that it was a suicide, the victim’s sister searches for the sinister truth behind the tragedy.

31134: The Escapees finds two young women—one of who is on the run from a mental institution—embark on an unusual quest with a group of erotic dancers.

111435: Lav Diaz’s epic meditation on the role of the artist and the rise of fundamentalism in the world today. His subject, a filmmaker, struggles to finish his latest work, while dealing with pressure from his co-workers, festival programmers, girlfriends and the press.

92478: The drunken stork loses his baby ape for Mr. and Mrs. Ape on a jungle island. So, he knocks out Bugs Bunny and delivers him instead.

7958: Claire Cooper dreams strange things from time to time. One night, she dreams about a little girl being taken away by a stranger. When her own daughter Rebecca is kidnapped and murdered, Claire is sure about the chilling truth that her and the killer’s mind are connected to each other in dreams.

5575: A scientific expedition searching for fossils along the Amazon River discover a prehistoric monster in the legendary Black Lagoon. The explorers capture the mysterious creature, but it breaks free and returns to kidnap a scientist’s beautiful lab assistant.

131626: One peaceful day on Earth, two remnants of Frieza’s army named Sorbet and Tagoma arrive searching for the Dragon Balls with the aim of reviving Frieza. They succeed, and Frieza subsequently seeks revenge on the Saiyans.

32093: After meeting at a nightclub in a Mediterranean resort, seven young adults decide to continue partying aboard a luxury yacht in the middle of the ocean. But when one of them dies in a freak accident, the others argue about what to do, which leads to a ruthless fight for survival.

28955: This film is based on the James Simon Kunen book about student unrest on the Columbia University campus.

57946: The creatures of the night face off with kung fu masters in this vampire film with an Asian twist. After giving a lecture in China, Prof. Van Helsing is approached by a man from the village of Ping Kuei.
The Legend of the 7 Golden Vampires

29773: Starts out with a tribe of African cannibals imitating Native Americans. After this, they do the new Warner Bros. Looney Tunes theme “The Merry-Go-Round Broke Down.”

3586: Titled after the name of a little girl’s dress size, the coming-of-age drama 36 Fillette follows a couple days in the life of 14-year-old Lili (Delphine Zentout), whose physically mature features contrast with her immature adolescent angst.

28529: A visual montage portrait of our contemporary world dominated by gobalized technology and violence.

34060: An artist-criminal far from home asks his assistant to pirate a rare videotape before the German Post Office Authorities come to confiscate it.

30886: A couple who participated in a potent medical experiment gain telekinetic ability and then have a child who is pyrokinetic.

4317: Mark (Colin Farrell), a war photographer, returns home from Kurdistan without his friend and colleague David (Jamie Sives). As time goes on, it becomes clear that Mark holds the key to the truth of David’s disappearance.

28075: A snobbish investor and a wily street con artist find their positions reversed as part of a bet by two callous millionaires.

6346: Ning Tsai-Shen, a humble tax collector, arrives in a small town to carry out his work. No-one is willing to give him shelter for the night, so he ends up in the haunted Lan Ro temple. There, he meets Taoist Swordsman Yen Che-Hsia, and the beautiful Nieh Hsiao-Tsing, with whom he falls in love.

36875: This film memorializes the leader of Vietnam, Ho Chi Minh, on the occasion of his death. It narrates the story of a life which is also the story of a nation—recounting his important accomplishments in the struggle against colonialism and imperialism.

789: Volker Schlöndorff’s visionary, surreal adaptation of Nobel laureate Günter Grass’ acclaimed novel depicts a boy caught in a baffling state of perpetual childhood while the chaotic world marches onward to the madness and folly of World War II.

4273: Few famous novels have been filmed as often as Alexandre Dumas’ The Count of Monte Cristo—and few versions are as enjoyable as this 1934 adaptation starring Robert Donat. Donat plays Edmond Dantes, wrongly accused of a plot against the post-Napoleonic French government.

88986: Music video for Icelandic band Sigur Rós, depicting a group of 10 or so young adults participating in nudism or naturism.

37653: Travelling Actors depicts a troupe of wandering kabuki players traveling through rural Japan and their troubles with horses, both two-person and real.

88656: Comedy. When news that a family member with his new bride is soon to pay a courtesy visit, Mrs. Effat goes out of her way to put together a welcome beyond their means – harrying not only her immediate family, but the local community as well.

30632: A short film by Henri Plaat, as a part of his 2008 exhibition.

31468: The film documents the years between their graduation and the beginning of the World War in Europe, and shows, in a serialized style, their romances and marriages, their searches for careers or meaning in their lives, their highs and their lows.

95145: Father and daughter are getting ready for a grand procession through the village, but things are strained between them. Dad has arranged for his thirteen-year-old daughter Maria to play the Virgin Mary. Maria doesn’t want to, but her father insists. He hopes that this will heal her.

92288: After his wife is assaulted, a husband enlists the services of a vigilante group to help him settle the score.

425: An affluent and unexceptional homemaker in the suburbs becomes allergic to her environment – car fumes, the dry-cleaners and even the new couch. Welcoming retreat, she finally ends up in a creepy New Age healing center.

89870: A transsexual prostitute from a middle-class Texas family waits for her clients by listening to Gorecki and drinking Diet Coke. Her chambermaid comforts her.

2048: The cycle of life of a handful of different animals is captured on film in a whole new way in this documentary. Using special motion-control photography equipment, Genesis allows filmgoers to view animal behaviors which are too small, too slow, or too difficult to normally be seen.

33439: The story follows the life of Baron Hieronymus von Münchhausen who was granted immortality by a sorcerer some 200 years previously….

30756: When overworked Michael Newman returns home one stressful evening, armed with a top-of-the-line universal remote, he soon realizes that it does more than control the household appliances: the new remote actually works on time and people.

32707: Outlaw Clint Hollister escapes from jail with the help of Marshal Jake Wade, because once Clint did the same for him. Jake left Clint just after, but Clint finds him back and forces Jake to lead him to a loot Jake buried one year ago when he quitted Clint’s gang.

3376: A passionate English professor at a conservative boarding school inspires his students to defy convention and seize the potential of every day through his teaching of poetry.

541: Jeremy Irons plays a pair of identical twin gynecologists who share a practice, a living space, and female companions, but the arrival of a new patient starts to test the bonds of their relationship in this critically-acclaimed thriller.

44867: A 1910 British short black-and-white silent documentary film showing the life-cycle of the butterfly.
The History of a Butterfly: A Romance of Insect Life

47610: Will Hayes, a 30-something Manhattan dad is in the midst of a divorce when his 10 year old daughter, Maya, starts to question him about his life before marriage.

25110: A middle-aged disc jockey becomes romantically entangled with a pair of sisters in this quirky Australian comedy.

46836: Loose rendition of Clement C. Moore’s famous poem. St. Nick is seen delivering the toys he made in last year’s “Santa’s Workshop.”

25074: The Latino doorman of a New York apartment building begins to unravel when he is seduced and then dumped by a privileged college kid who lives in the building.

83974: As the evil Friend rules over the apocalyptic future of 2015, Kenji’s teen niece, Kanna, is punished for her anti-Friend behavior while the remaining members of the Secret Base gang reunite over a shocking find: The New Book of Prophecies.
20th Century Boys: Chapter 2: The Last Hope

100545: Brasilia is the scenery for the encounter between two girls. Ana and Leila share a friendship and the typical teenage coming of age.
The Art of Walking Through the Streets

107688: Martin and Claudia are lawyers — and ex-lovers — who find themselves put at risk after they join the defense team for an international terrorist’s trial.

39941: The inhabitants of Antonio Island, off the coast of Oregon, are about to unveil a statue honoring the four men (Castle, Wayne, Williams and Malone) who founded their town in 1871.

45725: The story of a hockey player who returns to the game as a coach of a women’s hockey team.

125766: A drama based on the experiences of Agu, a child soldier fighting in the civil war of an unnamed African country.

27389: Suzuki is a high school student who aspires to become a great swimmer, however, he is the only person in the school’s swimming team.

22015: A young revolutionary hastily flees Tokyo with his sister-in-law after accidentally shooting his brother, a cop, during a heated argument. Together they head north and hide out in snowy outskirts while debating running or turning themselves in.
Running in Madness, Dying in Love

43806: A magician performs his latest tricks.

126409: A tower block on an inner city estate. An elevator that’s not up to the job. Three chance meetings. Six peculiar characters with stories to tell.

45991: Bill Hicks tells us how he feels about non-smokers, blow-jobs, religion, war and peace, drugs and music.

31423: A Berlin-set drama centered on a 40-something couple who, separately, fall in love with the same man.

1208: In a barren landscape of ice and snow, two men and a sleigh are on an absurd voyage. This was the last of Roman Polanski’s short films before he began work on his first feature, Knife In The Water. It received awards at Oberhausen and Melbourne.

30679: This wordless wonder examines life in the wake of the Armenian–Azerbaijan conflict, as seen through the eyes of a stray buffalo.

32628: Santo, The Silver Masked Man (aka El Enmascarado de Plata) faces Count Dracula for an epic battle.

3259: From the dawn of man to the distant future, mankind’s evolution (or lack thereof) is traced.
History of the World: Part I

4194: From the time he was a high-school student in Lubbock, Texas until his tragic death at age 22 in 1959, Buddy Holly ignored the condemnation by townspeople and his conservative relatives and dedicated his life to rock ’n roll.

33472: Told through the eyes of sticky-fingered eight-year-old boy Big Ears, whose mother and father run the neighborhood shoe store, and his older brother Desmond is every family’s dream son – an outstanding athlete with grades worthy of Hong Kong’s best school…

2003: Loosely based on the exploits of depression-era lovers and bandits, Bonnie and Clyde. They fatefully meet when Clyde attempts to steal Bonnie’s mother’s car. Excited by his outlaw demeanor, she joins him on a crime spree that ends in one of the bloodiest death scenes in cinematic history

15692: Now in his fifth year at Hogwarts, Harry Potter finds his warning about Voldemort’s return ignored, so he must prepare a group of students for the evil forces descending upon the school.
Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix

11754: In the final days of the Han Dynasty, shrewd Prime Minister Cao Cao convinces the fickle Emperor that the only way to unite all of China is to declare war on the kingdoms to the west and the south.  Thus the battle begins…  Starring Asian superstars Tony Leung, Takeshi Kaneshiro, and Zhao Wei.

35481: After numerous failed attempts to commit suicide, our hero (Lloyd) runs into a lawyer who is looking for a stooge to stand in as a groom in order to secure an inheritance for his client…

114076: On the Japanese island of Amami-Oshima, a 14-year-old boy named Kaito stumbles upon a dead body floating in the sea. He attempts to solve the mystery of the body with the help of his girlfriend Kyoko as the pair experience growth through exposure to the never-ending cycle of life, death, and love.

15942: A young priest is ordered to preside over the wake of witch in a small old wooden church of a remote village. This means spending three nights alone with the corpse with only his faith to protect him.

29264: Six women attempt to make it in current day Tokyo, living their everyday lives the best and worst they can. For them, every little moment becomes a ritual of the ordinary and the exciting, a balancing act for their dreams and hopes as the days perpetually tug on their heartstrings.

3091: With the Australian outback circa 1880s serving as the backdrop, comes the story of the Burns Brother gang. Charlie is given nine days to kill his psychopathic brother otherwise his younger mentally slowly brother will be hung. On Christmas Day.

113017: A single mother, plagued by the violent death of her husband, battles with her son’s fear of a monster lurking in the house, but soon discovers a sinister presence all around her.

36526: Proposing further evidence that film material is not inert, this film was made by literally burying pieces of black film during different periods of time and in different kinds of grounds.

32584: An English professor finds his life crumbling around him.

4238: Benjamin becomes determined to find the real culprit of an old murder that he believes wasn’t properly solved—a quest both complicated and exhilarating.

21255: A talent scout brings a young singer to São Paulo, intent on introducing her to a renowned conductor. As they wait for the day of the audition, they stay in a hotel room where, the scout foresees the singer’s future in the cigarette pack warnings as if they were tarot cards.

26198: It’s a murder story set in the small Breton fishing town of St. Malo. A young schoolgirl is found raped and murdered in the woods. The new female chief inspector Frédérique Lesage makes her chief suspect the mentally fragile failed artist René Sterne, who was the girl’s private art teacher.

44698: Using found footage from East German, Soviet and Polish archives, as well as some amateur photography, this documentary builds a picture of the culture of German Nazism, including some of the films of the Nazi ministry of propaganda.

41978: This film deals with a Jewish family in Montreal, Canada as they care for a dying grandmother and the young boy who is impatient to get the room he was promised as soon as she kicks the bucket.

79398: Igor is a brilliant young scientist sidelined by a physical deformity. Despite his position as a lowly assistant to mad Dr. Glickenstein, Igor dreams of winning the Evil Science Fair and the heart of Gretchen, a village beauty.

23204: The film stars popular rock singer Viktor Tsoy, here cast as Moro, a young man with a mission. Reunited with his former lover Dina Marina Smirnova, Moro discovers that the woman has become a prostitute and dope addict. He devotes his life to rescuing Dina from her sordid lifestyle.

104764: A group of astronaut explorers succumb one by one to a mysterious and terrifying force while collecting specimens on Mars.

43431: The Secret Adventures of Gustave Klopp

99355: Gracinda, a young laundry washer, lives with her godfather, “Uncle” Jacinto, and together they run a family business, doing the laundry for residents of Lisbon in their small village in the outskirts of that city.

104600: Adapted from the 1951 non-fiction account by psychoanalyst Georges Devereux, “Psychotherapy Of A Plains Indian,” the film follows the true story of Picard, a Plains Indian of the Blackfeet nation, as he returns from WWII and begins experiencing unexplainable symptoms shortly thereafter.
Jimmy P: Psychotherapy of a Plains Indian

23360: Cheng the fruit seller is in love with the daughter of his neighbor the doctor, but the good doctor won’t let him marry her unless Chang finds him more patients.

22296: Containing more than two thousand cuts and a wealth of inventive widescreen compositions, this coolly fragmented character study is a mesmerizing investigation of criminality and social decay.

46401: This is the story of Pedro, who by having his head being pushed down so much learned how to breathe under water.

38648: The movie revolves around the life of a tax collector who is accused of taking bribes, and also has to deal with problems at home, including the suicide attempt of his wife.

44450: A young mongoose protects his human family from two murderous cobras.

19601: Sequel to “Tetsou” this time has the Iron Man transforming into cyberkinetic gun when a gang of vicious skinheads kidnap his son. When the skinheads capture him, they begin to experiment on him…speeding up the mutative process!

26350: A large Irish woman falsely accuses Buster of breaking a window and hauls him before a Polish judge who speaks no English and assumes they are there to be married. She takes her new husband home to meet her brutish family. Made a year after Buster had got married and supported his wife’s family.

87485: Found-footage upside-down, backwards spinning. Industrialization reversed, or the charm of the noble savage.
By Night with Torch and Spear

24265: The cruelty of children is offered in all its unadorned ugliness in “Grazuole”. The title character is a 9-year-old girl, shunned by her classmates because of her alleged homeliness.

44534: DOUBLE DARE is a double-barreled, action-packed documentary about the struggles of two stuntwomen in male-dominated Tinseltown to stay working, stay thin, and stay sane.

123737: When aliens misinterpret video-feeds of classic arcade games as a declaration of war against them, they attack the Earth, using the games as models for their various assaults.

38971: A troubled man talks to his suicidal sister’s psychiatrist about their family history and falls in love with her in the process.

86882: A poor tailor in Baghdad wins the hand of a princess thanks to a series of adventures involving a magic lamp and the genie that lurks within.

20182: In 1941 Hawaii, a private is cruelly punished for not boxing on his unit’s team, while his captain’s wife and second in command are falling in love.

101909: When Yosemite Sam campaigns on a platform including rabbit genocide, Bugs runs against him.

39757: Abel, a French prisoner of war in East Prussia, is forced by evil circumstances into the task of recruiting young boys to be trained in the Nazi army—with or without their consent.

24044: A road movie about a German man (Peter Ketnath) who went to the North East of Brazil in the 1942 to sell aspirin.

23389: Traveling from France to Tangiers, a man looks to reunite with his former love, though their romance ended some 30 years earlier.

19938: A compassionate young officer, Lieutenant DeBuin, is given a small company to find him and bring him back; accompanying the troop is McIntosh, an experienced scout, and Ke-Ni-Tay, an Apache guide.

98082: In the 1930s, an elderly Tonto tells a young boy the tale of John Reid, the Lone Ranger. An idealistic lawyer, he rides with his brother and fellow Texas Rangers in pursuit of the notorious Butch Cavendish.

38815: Bugs and Daffy tunnel to Baghdad where they find caves full of treasure and a guard named Hassan who wants only to “chop” them.

41991: About being lost and found, from moment to moment, and over the course of a lifetime. The spirit realm manifests in lo-tech effects and remembered TV movies.

24120: Solange is a filmmaker. She is married and a mother. She enjoys occasional sex with her husband but also feels drawn towards a bisexual actor named Jim. This doesn’t prevent her from taking other lovers – sometimes as many as two or three in one night. Solange is looking for frenzied love.

45857: A dancing bear escapes from the zoo and finds his way to Tom and Jerry’s house. He dances with Tom, making it impossible for Tom to call the authorities; Jerry takes every opportunity to play music and keep Tom and the bear dancing.

119332: Ready or not, change was coming to America. The fault lines were no longer ignorable—cities were burning, Vietnam was exploding, disputes raged over women’s rights, gay rights, and civil rights.
The Black Panthers: Vanguard of the Revolution

23141: Lena is a woman in her late twenties who loves her boyfriend but in time comes to see that their relationship serves no useful function. What’s more, she sees that her friends are for the most part empty-headed lackeys, causing her to wonder just what is the point of her life.

120690: A comedy that follows the lives two co-dependent sisters who work as hotel maids in Fresno.

86752: Geek god Nathan Fillion fills in as the voice of Green Lantern Hal Jordan in this six-story anthology of adventures built around the crime-fighting prowess of the intergalactic Green Lantern Corps (and based on the popular DC Comics characters).

23025: A young family moves into a house with a past: the previous owner was the deranged Dr. Freudstein, whose monstrous human experiments have left a legacy of bloody mayhem. Now, home sweet home is about to become a horrific hell on earth.

21074: On the pretext of going ptarmigan hunting, Vincent Lemieux, a father and notorious fraud artist wanted by police, goes to the taiga of northern Québec to meet a pilot friend who’ll help him escape the country. Along the way, he makes confessions on video to apologize to his two young daughters.

84703: In this anime thriller based on the popular series, young Saki journeys to New York to find her missing friend Akira Takizawa — a mysterious man who thwarted a missile attack against Japan — and save him from the dangerous Seleção.
Eden of the East the Movie I: The King of Eden

37439: Angie Rossini, an innocent New York City sales clerk from a repressive Italian-American family, engages in a short-lived affair with a handsome jazz musician named Rocky Papasano. When Angie becomes pregnant, she tracks down Rocky, and he attempts to make her an honest woman.

93114: Band sings in a woodland area, clips of DJ Hurricane & Money Mark interspersed throughout. Sky has a photo negative effect, a direct allusion to the werewolf POV in 1981 horror film Wolfen. Also, the infrared style incorporated during the band cutaways area homage to the hunter vision in Predator.

1385: On a busy Paris boulevard, a youth scornfully tosses a crumpled paper bag into the outstretched hands of a beggar woman. This is the bond which, for an instant, links several very different characters: an actress, a war photographer, a farmer, a music teacher, and an immigrant.
Code Unknown: Incomplete Tales of Several Journeys

117294: Doug Harris is a loveable but socially awkward groom-to-be with a problem: he has no best man. With less than two weeks to go until he marries the girl of his dreams, Doug is referred to Jimmy Callahan, owner and CEO of Best Man, Inc.

48856: In writer-director Michael Crichton’s sci-fi thriller, a seemingly innocent excursion to a futuristic “Fantasy Island” turns deadly for two wealthy tourists seeking cowboy adventures in the island’s Westworld sector.

91145: A Disney-ized retelling of Dumas’ classic story of three swordsmen of the disbanded French king’s guard plus one young man who dreams to become one of them, who seek to save their King from the scheming of the Cardinal Richelieu.

29121: Short abstract animation from visual music pioneer Oskar Fischinger.

37845: A New York psychiatrist finds that a voodoo cult, which believes in child sacrifice, has a keen interest in his own son.

35468: The crews of the Enterprise and the Excelsior must stop a plot to prevent a peace treaty between the Klingon Empire and the Federation.
Star Trek VI: The Undiscovered Country

68639: In this HBO special, Emmy-winning comedian and writer Louis C.K. performs his controversial brand of no-holds-barred stand-up comedy in front of an exuberant audience at the Henry Fonda Theater in Los Angeles.

54007: Anne Marie lives to surf. She hits the Hawaiian beach every day before dawn, riding the waves all day with her friends Eden and Lena. But when she falls for pro football player Matt, will she let love get in the way of her life-long dream?

36707: A group of young mods and beatniks dance to an obscure french rock band, Les Ingoes, in a club. A short documentary of the French Swinging Sixties.

30690: The Kingdom II: Part 1 - Death on the Operation Table

16514: Ricky Santoro is a flamboyant and corrupt Atlantic City cop with a dream: become so well connected that he can become mayor. In lieu of that, he’ll settle for keeping his comfortable lifestyle. On the night of the heavyweight boxing championship, Rick becomes mixed up in an assassination.

29045: Young Soviet Army recruits are sent from a boot camp into the middle of the war in Afghanistan. The action is not like a boot camp at all. It is very bloody and dirty.

487: This remake of the 1932 Howard Hawks film of the same name substitutes the crime world of 1920s Chicago with the drug trade of 1980s Miami, as violent, megalomaniac Cuban drug lord Tony Montana ascends the mob ranks.

88924: A young girl sent to live with her father and his new girlfriend discovers creatures in her new home who want to claim her as one of their own.
Don't Be Afraid of the Dark

33737: A reckless student protester contemplates terrorism in a prescient film that confirmed Masahiro Shinoda as a fearless member of Japan’s iconoclastic New Wave.

109544: In a theater, in front of a popular audience, is staging a comic version of Shakespeare’s tragedy Othello: the characters are actors-puppets.

2346: Two young drifters guide a Mormon wagon train to the San Juan Valley and encounter cutthroats, Indians, geography, and moral challenges on the journey.

110391: Those horns kick in, and we’re transported into breathtaking music-video territory. Stop-motion animation was the name of this new game, with Peter Gabriel allowing himself to lie under a sheet of glass for 16 hours while filming “Sledgehammer” one frame at a time.

32911: Deprived of a normal childhood by her ambitious mother, Katie, Lillian Roth becomes a star of Broadway and Hollywood before she is twenty. Shortly before her marriage to her childhood sweetheart, David Tredman, he dies and Lillian takes her first drink of many down the road of becoming an alcoholic.

2222: Kore-eda’s acclaimed film is what the Japanese call a “home drama”, chronicling the 24-hour reunion of the Yokoyama family on the anniversary of the death of their elder son. During the day and night, we see all that unites and divides this particular family – and makes it just like any other.

33653: Injured while risking his life to save an angry German shepard, Chicago Firefighter Jack Moniker retires and moves to a small carribean island named St. Nicholas. There, he is befriended by the owner of a run-down resort, Ernest Reed. Greedy developers are schemeing to wrest Reed’s coveted beach fro

11411: A John Waters film where Divine plays Diane Linkletter, daughter of Art Linkletter and commits suicide.

32409: Gabin is André, a successful, straightfaced and long-married lawyer. He is approached by a young girl named Yvette (Brigitte Bardot) who has been arrested for shoplifting with her friend, and she offers her body as payment. André begins a torrid, self-destructive affair…

30458: After the funeral of her grandmother in Dallas, Lisa Reisert boards the dreaded red eye for a flight back to Miami so she can make it to work the next day. On board, Lisa meets Jackson Ripner and their attraction grows. But moments after take-off, Jackson reveals  his real reason for being on board.

116362: This erotically charged drama from Japanese director Ryuichi Hiroki (Vibrator) traces the intersecting stories of a group of employees and visitors at a notorious “love hotel” in Tokyo’s red-light district.

32875: After two years under German rule, a small Norwegian fishing village rises up and revolts against the occupying Nazis.

94175: An FBI Agent seeks vengeance on a mysterious assassin known as “Rogue” who murdered his partner.

53102: At Pridemore Juvenile Facility, a reform school for girls, headmaster Charlie wreaks havoc on young lives alongside her cohorts Edna and tough-as-nails warden Sutter. This is the nightmare that greets innocent Jenny upon her arrival.

48786: John Wayne teams with Kirk Douglas in this horse opera about an impenetrable stagecoach chock-full of gold bullion. The Duke plays a disenfranchised rancher planning to swipe the gold from a ruthless cattle baron who bilked him out of his land.

22350: The lackluster and plodding Bolweiser has the (mis)fortune to be married to the town’s siren; his trusting nature leads him into serious trouble when she beds nearly every available guy.

40450: Two college students share a ride home for the holidays. When they break down on a deserted stretch of road, they’re preyed upon by the ghosts of people who have died there.

87427: A woman (Marie Gillain) and a man (Vincent Lindon), two friends, two Judges who believe in law, but also in humanity, try to oppose the ironclad logic of the powerful. In doing so, their destinies and lives cross paths with those of the victims.

26296: The year’s 2033 and since a humongous meteor hit the earth, the world just hasn’t been the same….

125423: Depressed housewife learns her husband was killed in a car accident the day previously, awakens the next morning to find him alive and well at home, and then awakens the next day after to a world in which he is still dead.

102499: Popular comic Jamel Debbouze plays a jungle guide in the fictitious South American country of Palombia, where he shows around a bumbling TV reporter. The journo is hoping to spot a marsupilami.
HOUBA! On the Trail of the Marsupilami

42919: Ode, in black and white, to immigrants, from Calais, from elsewhere.
May They Rest in Revolt (Figures of War)

118047: Tokyo has been decimated by a terrorist attack, and the only clue to the culprit’s identity is a bizarre internet video. While paranoia spreads, two mysterious children form “Sphinx,” a clandestine entity determined to pull the trigger on this world.

20265: On the eve of the Meiji restoration that was to modernise Japan, orphan Jiro, raised by the monk Tenkai in the strict rules and traditions of bushido, is wrongly accused of matricide.

27204: An American spy behind the lines during WWII serves as a Nazi propagandist, a role he cannot escape in his future life as he can never reveal his real role in the war.

103913: While settling his recently deceased father’s estate, a salesman discovers he has a sister whom he never knew about, leading both siblings to re-examine their perceptions about family and life choices.

43493: The veneer of the story is a tale of chance love: two French expatriates strike up a chance romance when they meet on a ship headed back to South America.

120577: A beauty-salon worker and pirate-DVD enthusiast accidentally comes into possession of incriminating evidence of high-level political corruption, in this romantic drama by renowned Indonesian director Joko Anwar.

25255: Charlotte Hollis, an aging recluse deluded into a state of dementia by horrible memories and hallucinations, lives in a secluded house where, thirty-seven years before, John Mayhew her married lover, was beheaded and mutilated by an unknown assailant.

67622: Kuno Becker reprises his role as rising soccer star Santiago Munez in the second installment of the Goal! trilogy, which features footballer David Beckham and most of the cast from the original film.

100600: Naked Harbour is a film about to be seen and touched. Set in a Helsinki suburb, it tells a story about a welfare state in the era of individuality and Reality TV. Two weeks of life in a modern suburbia shows people yearning for life and love.

25331: While struggling to reconnect after the death of their daughter, a married couple construct an elaborate game of pretend on a series of blind dates, hoping that they will be able to openly talk about the state of their relationship in the wake of tragedy.

38422: A young black man (Tyrese Gibson), after spending too many years living at home with his mother and not acting like a real father to his child, finally accepts his responsibilites as a man and a father.

121649: A man with the ability to enter peoples’ memories takes on the case of a brilliant, troubled sixteen-year-old girl to determine whether she is a sociopath or a victim of trauma.

97251: The video consists solely of a single close-up shot of Thom Yorke’s head inside an astronaut-style dome helmet. The lyrics are shown throughout the entire song slowly scrolling upwards but mirrored, as they are being reflected off of the dome.

760: With his customary restraint and ruthless attention to detail, director Jean-Pierre Melville follows the parallel tracks of French underworld criminal Gu (Lino Ventura), escaped from prison and roped into one last robbery, and the suave inspector, Blot (Paul Meurisse), relentlessly seeking him.

10764: An investigator from the War Crimes Commission (Edward G. Robinson) travels to Connecticut to find an infamous Nazi, who may be hiding out in a small town in the guise of a distinguished professor (Orson Welles).

108755: After her mother’s mysterious death, Nica begins to suspect that the talking, red-haired doll her visiting niece has been playing with may be the key to recent bloodshed and chaos.

3157: After some years of tension, Richard begins a sexual relationship with his sister Natalie. Now married, the relationship proves dangerously obsessive.

50226: Chad Gates just wants to sing, chase girls and have fun, but someone wants to stop the party! In Blue Hawaii, that someone is Chad’s mom, who wants her ex-soldier son to come work in the family pineapple business.

30577: A sexy but poor young girl marries a rich man she doesn’t love, but carries a torch for another man.

93397: The storyline is about a son’s father (Lars Karlsteen) and mother (Maud Backeus) who come to visit him (Peter Egge) and his girlfriend (Kajsa Wilund) for the first time. The father continually criticizes the living condition his son is living in.

1106: The life of Christ and events as narrated in the Gospel of St. Matthew.
The Gospel According to St. Matthew

128546: A police officer and a psychologist investigate the deaths of five people who were killed while trying to summon ghosts.

50342: Satan’s son is all grown up in this second sequel to the 1976 horror hit. Now in his 30s, Damien Thorn is America’s newly minted ambassador to England and leader of the world’s largest multinational corporation.

114378: Good policing doesn’t necessarily mean doing everything by the book. But as the business of crime in London turns to favour the Albanians and Turks, how does a “good” policeman survive?

3033: A French intelligence agent becomes embroiled in the Cold War politics first with uncovering the events leading up to the 1962 Cuban Missle Crisis, and then back to France to break up an international Russian spy ring.

108631: Adam Bell is a Toronto area History college professor. He is a rather somber man, largely because he is stuck in a routine, which includes a relationship with his live-in girlfriend, Mary. While watching a rental movie, he spots an actor in a bit part that looks like him.

2269: Documentary that chronicles how Francis Ford Coppola’s “Apocalypse Now” was plagued by extraordinary script, shooting, budget, and casting problems—nearly destroying the life and career of the celebrated director.
Hearts of Darkness: A Filmmaker's Apocalypse

604: In Liliana Cavani’s scintillating drama, a concentration camp survivor (Charlotte Rampling) discovers her ex-torturer/lover (Dirk Bogarde) working as a night porter at a hotel in postwar Vienna.

31649: Synthetic kryptonite laced with tobacco tar splits Superman in two: good Clark Kent and bad Man of Steel.

36584: A pair of reckless siblings are dragged into a chaotic family wedding by their overwrought mother as she arrives at her parents’ Annapolis estate.

30413: Rinko Kikucho, Meisa Kuroki and Hinako Saeki play three seductive huntresses roaming a post-apocalyptic desert on the trail of giant metamorphic creatures called “sand whales” that are responsible for destroying the planet.

88477: The conflict between a young idealist and an authoritarian, both trying to cultivate the steppes of Kyrgyzstan.

15630: This crazily plotted 1946 adaptation of Cornell Woolrich’s The Black Path of Fear, the very essence of “film noir,” features Robert Cummings as an everyman vet whose life is turned upside down when he finds a wallet that belongs to a sadistic gangster.

111348: The music video shows the guilt felt by a man over an affair, and his acknowledgement that his partner was always going to find out. It was taped on location in Miami during June 1984 and features such locales as Coconut Grove and Watson Island.

37472: Inspired by true events, follows skeptical seminary student Michael Kovak, who reluctantly attends exorcism school at the Vatican.

16847: Not even the joys of parenthood can stop married sleuths Nick and Nora Charles from investigating a murder on a Long Island estate.

14816: Based on the letters of Colonel Robert G. Shaw. Shaw was an officer in the Federal Army during the American Civil War who volunteered to lead the first company of black soldiers.

4052: A free spirited sculptor enters into a passionate affair with the beautiful Olga, whose thirst for sexual experimentation matches his own. As their romance progresses, the two decide to marry, but their relationship is opposed by Olga’s mother.

56179: While on business in Eastern Europe, opportunistic talent agent Sammy inadvertently finds himself in the company of a 7-foot, 7-inch Romanian giant named Max (played by professional hoopster Gheorghe Muresan).

34679: Sonia has delayed joining her husband Jo in Trinidad to care for her mother, who’s just had a stroke. But after six months, she packs up her two young children and leaves Norway for the Caribbean. Upon her arrival, she experiences much more than culture shock…

37516: The family consisting of two pandas and one girl lives happily when suddenly a little tiger appears at their home. It arrives that the circus had come to their town. All of a sudden starts the pouring rain but it can’t stop them.

6167: A young policewoman slowly goes insane while tracking down an elusive serial rapist/killer through Italy when she herself becomes a victim of the brutal man’s obsession.

28254: The audience enters Porky’s movie theater, with a collection of quick gags: A firefly acting as usher, a kangaroo taking tickets and putting the stubs in her pouch, a chicken buying child tickets for her eggs.

17705: In director Leslie H. Martinson’s campy action comedy based on the tongue-in-cheek 1960s TV series, Batman (Adam West) and Robin (Burt Ward) battle sharks, Catwoman (Lee Meriwether), The Joker (Cesar Romero), The Penguin (Burgess Meredith) and The Riddler (Frank Gorshin) on the big screen.

48979: To fund his ambition of owning a bakery, ex-con Ray Gleason plans a heist of rare coins — which goes off well until Ray’s estranged son, Timmy, turns up and holds the loot hostage in this genial family comedy.

4136: Some of the world’s most innovative documentary filmmakers explore the hidden side of everything.

72694: In the year 1000, aliens from the planet Quetzalcoatl flee their dying planet and take refuge under the Earth’s surface…

190: Set in a small fictional town in the U.S. during the 1930s. Filmed in a studio with a minimal set, it tells the story of Grace, a young girl on the run from gangsters, who takes refuge in the small mining town of Dogville.

110956: Roman, after discovering his impotence, urges his wife Hanka to take a lover. She reluctantly complies, and Roman, despite his earlier words, becomes obsessively jealous. Spying on her, he learns of her affair, and vows to kill himself…

16003: Two marriages and four lives are brought to a crossroads by infidelity in this drama, based on a pair of short stories by author Andre Dubus.

130739: A set of twins — one a hard-working student and the other a drifter — team up with a dropout to unlock the secrets of the universe and to build one of their own.

14052: Lester is an occasional substitute teacher and he’s very jealous about the last boyfriend of his slightly wacky current partner Ramona, arrogant bestselling author Dashiell. Lester joins Dashiell’s therapy group under an alias to find out if Dashiell still has any feelings for her.

93567: Sumptuous and intimate, Benoît Jacquot’s portrayal of court life at Versailles during four crucial days of the French Revolution is a fascinating picture of social breakdown—mounting chaos calmly observed.

30387: On the 100th anniversary of the founding of a watchmaking company in Geneva, its owner Charles Dé gives his family the slip and moves in with a young couple he meets by chance, doing the cooking, reading, drinking, and engaging in philosophical discussions with them.

48059: An Irish bomber escapes from prison and targets a member of the Boston bomb squad.

54510: When the vile villain Ivan Ooze is released from the prison where he has languished for millennia, he seeks vengeance against his captor — the Power Rangers’ own mentor, Zordon.
Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: The Movie

2981: An ambitious Asian Briton and his white lover strive for success and hope, when they open up a glamorous laundromat.

74667: NYPD detective Stan Aubray is obsessed with catching a serial killer whose slayings resemble a case Aubray solved years earlier. But the bizarre crime scenes require Aubray to study everything — including his own dark past — in a new light.

36374: Through a series of flashbacks, four young Chinese women born in America and their respective mothers born in feudal China, explore their past. This search will help them understand their difficult mother/daughter relationship.

1692: Communist, anti-colonialist, right-wing extremist? What convictions guide the moral mind of Jacques Vergès? Barbet Schroeder takes us down history’s darkest paths in his attempt to illuminate the mystery behind this enigmatic figure.

31315: A portrait of a fictional town in the mid west that is home to a group of idiosyncratic and slightly neurotic characters. Dwayne Hoover is a wealthy car dealer-ship owner that’s on the brink of suicide and is losing touch with reality.

89371: This is a tragicomic story about boys who even in times of war remember how to play soldiers, dream of heroic deeds, spy on girls, show off in front of friends, and make up fantastic adventures.

48291: Turkish comedy about high school students in a private school.

37282: A frustrated composer finds fulfillment as a high school music teacher.

3913: Charlotte is young and modern, not a hair out of place, superficial, cool; she reads fashion magazines – does she have the perfect bust? She lives in a Paris suburb with her son and her husband Pierre, a pilot. Her lover is Robert, an actor.

129324: The story of a friendship spanning generations and boundaries: a Hungarian soldier escapes to the West in the 50’s. The son of a U.S. soldier runs to the East in the 90’s. Their paths cross in Bogotá, Colombia, and they become friends by sharing memories of the same land but of very different times.

13157: A small army of Greeks spearheaded by 300 Spartans do battle with the whole invading Persian army.

11106: American soldier, obviously very skilled in martial arts, single-handedly takes on mercenaries in the Philippines.

1942: Fog-enshrouded cinematography by Harold Rosson, expressionist set design by Hans Dreier, and sensual performances by Bancroft and Compson make this one of the legendary director’s finest works, and one of the most exquisitely crafted films of its era.

2735: “Petition – The court of the complainants”, directed by Zhao Liang, is a unique testimony about China today. Since 1996 Zhao Liang has filmed the “petitioners”, who come from all over China to make complaints in Beijing about abuses and injustices committed by the local authorities.

358: Stranded in small country due to bad weather, passengers of a trans-euro train must hole up in a small hotel for the night. Socialite Iris Henderson meets old governess, Miss Froy, who vanishes without a trace by sunrise. The young woman investigates the mysterious disappearance.

33344: A ‘drawn’ film, with images that are constantly changing, drawings of landscapes that keep escaping, traces of faces, everything is almost what it is but never stays that way.

94506: 19-year-old Marsha is a model spokesperson in a strongly nationalistic Russian youth movement that aims to protect the country from its enemies. When she starts recognizing the organization’s flaws, she must take a stand for or against it.

129240: A film inspired by the deep listening of Pauline Oliveros’ music and the sublime stillness of Franco Piavoli’s cinema…

3877: With its long tracking shots through cavernous library hallways and its skeptical corresponding text, this film imagines the Bibliothèque Nationale as a forbiddingly inhuman landscape in which man attempts to imprison “knowledge” in an effort to counter the limits of his own memory.

31271: Ethan Hunt comes face to face with a dangerous and sadistic arms dealer while trying to keep his identity secret in order to protect his girlfriend.

2651: Delphine and Solange are two sisters living in Rochefort. Delphine is a dancing teacher and Solange composes and teaches the piano.

73762: Neophyte book editor Brett Eisenberg is paying her dues in New York’s literary world when she catches the eye of Archie Knox, a publishing mogul who’s several decades her senior — and has quite the reputation as a womanizer.

39324: A child borrows her grandmother’s magnifying glass to look at a newspaper ad for Bovril, at a watch, and then at a bird. The child shows grandma what she’s doing. The child looks next at grandma’s eye, then at a kitten.

24437: Tatsuo, a gruff-mannered woodsman who lives in the mountains near a Japanese coastal town, refuses to sell his land for a planned tourist theme park – the only resident to oppose the project.

44366: In Relation, the focus of the viewer’s attention is guided (and mocked) by pointers moving through the screen.

26466: Perempuan Punya Cerita is about four women filmmakers tackle four different stories about lives of marginalized women in Indonesia.

24553: Locked up in prison and awaiting execution, bored young vagabonds Bernardino (Ninetto Davoli) and Mammone (Franco Citti) pass their time competing in a vulgar storytelling competition, relating indecent accounts about castration, unsavory testicles and an atypical threesome.

46253: Based on Stieg Larsson’s posthumously published crime thriller trilogy, the story follows a disgraced journalist as he investigates the disappearance of an heiress from 40 years ago. Aided by a punky computer hacker they uncover immense corruption beyond anything they have ever imagined.
The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo

121271: High-school student Ed Wallis enters into a friendship with his neighbor, Ashby, a retired CIA assassin who only has a few months left to live.

25709: A documentary crew from the BBC arrives in L.A. intent on interviewing Heidi Fleiss, a year after her arrest for running a brothel but before she goes to trial…

42395: Stefan and Kai have good going business, self-grown cannabis screened as pizza delivering service. For now they only have to deal with plant-louses.

27758: Jack Stanton is running for president. The election is seen through the eyes of young Henry Burton. Along the way Stanton must deal with a sex scandal.

20495: The story of a young guy who commits a suicide when his girl friend leaves him but confronting with a destiny which has a different plan of nature for him.

26502: Everyone knows that the stork delivers babies, but where do the storks get the babies from? The answer lies up in the stratosphere, where cloud people sculpt babies from clouds and bring them to life.

20739: Israeli filmmaker Yoav Shamir’s documentary deals with anti-Semitism, which he claims never to have experienced personally, yet he hears the term used everyday.

42039: José finds out that the woman with whom he had been married for 30 years and then divorced had commited suicide. Nevertheless, her burial won’t take place until five days later.

21563: Footage selected from ‘East of Borneo’ and other films is arranged and edited so as to highlight actress Rose Hobart.

100194: A young playboy who learns he has one month until he becomes infertile sets out to procreate as much as possible…

23532: Romance and heartbreak walk hand-in-hand when Philip Chagal accidentally meets Helen Lawrence in a restaurant where she is a waitress.

99463: Philip (Pierce Brosnan), an Englishman living in Denmark, is a lonely, middle-aged widower and estranged single father. Ida (Trine Dyrholm) is a Danish hairdresser, recuperating from a long bout of illness, who’s just been left by her husband for a younger woman.

21407: In “Landscape Suicide” Benning continues his examination of Americana through the stories of two murderers. Ed Gein was a Wisconsin farmer and multiple murderer who taxidermied his victims in the 1950s.

27590: While recording sound effects for a slasher flick, Jack Terri accidentally records a political assassination. As he perilously romances the only eyewitness to the crime, together they uncover the truth.

45290: The Japanese ambassaor is visiting Marseilles to view the city police’s anti-gang tactics. During the visit, however, he is kidnapped by a group working for the Japanese yakuza.

23456: A bewildering, unnerving, surreal, blackly comic film from the visionary mind of Crispin Glover that tells the inner and outer struggles of a young man facing villains and demons on multiple planes.

1575: An estranged family is brought together upon the news of their mother’s worsening illness. But the tough-minded mother is not so keen on spending time with her bickering adult children. With her teenage grandson she meets for the first time, she will develop a profound bond.

94429: A short black-and-white silent film featuring Joseph Jefferson as the ne’er-do-well Rip Van Winkle, who emerges from Sleepy Hollow to find himself surrounded by mysterious dwarves.

3958: Mark Rappaport’s creative bio-pic about actress Jean Seberg is presented in a first-person, autobiographical format (with Seberg played by Mary Beth Hurt). He seamlessly interweaves cinema, politics, American society and culture, and film theory to inform, entertain, and move the viewer.
From the Journals of Jean Seberg

95673: When the world’s media descend on the remote Scottish island where a Hollywood actress is attempting to get married, a local girl is hired as a decoy bride to put the paparazzi off the scent.

36093: A friend visits his philandering friend just as that man’s scheme of being secretly simultaneously engaged to three flight attendants goes awry.

1909: An actress preparing to play in a historical epic is terrorized by someone faxing her pages from her stolen diary; has colorful flashbacks of her affair with a now-deceased man; and imagines black-and-white film-within-a-film scenes of the movie she is about to appear in.

35298: Following a mysterious decapitation of an insurance investigator, Police Inspector Peretti is put onto the case. Slowly more people are found dead… a man supposedly commits suicide, a women is strangled, another attacked in her flat… but all the clues lead to an unsolved case of kidnapping.

28893: A documentary on the checkered lives of inhabitants of a large apartment block near Copacabana beach.

51917: After top-rated TV talk show host Bobby Bishop suffers a meltdown on the air, he leaves his show and heads to New York City to find his ex-girlfriend, Lily.

96960: In this illuminating documentary, producer Keanu Reeves interviews many of the most innovative game-changers in the world of cinema to examine how the digital age has transformed the movies.

99: A screwball comedy centered on a Manhattan go-go dancing club, where a financial struggle between the owner, his accountant and his silent partner brother threatens the business’s future.

93680: Adolescence is like a heavy rain. Even though you catch a cold from it, you still look forward to experiencing it once again.
You Are the Apple of My Eye

157042: “Burn the Witch” is a song by the English rock band Radiohead off of 2016’s “A Moon Shaped Pool”. It was accompanied by a stop-motion animated music video that pays homage to the 1960s British children’s television programme Camberwick Green and the 1973 British horror film The Wicker Man.

1411: 30-ish Gabriel is in romantic transition from Jenny to Anne, while at his job as a literary editor much of his time and emotional energy is spent on his slightly older friend, a formerly “promising” novelist whose recent output fails to match the critical and commercial success of his earlier work.

3440: The same cyborg from the future that was once sent to kill Sarah Connor is now sent to protect her son and ensure the survival of mankind. But this time they are up against an even more powerful cyborg.

32031: After Playboy bunny Shelley is kicked out of the playboy mansion, she finds a job as the house mother for a sorority full of socially awkward girls.

50731: Buzykin is an English professor who gets hit with crises from all sides — his adoring wife, his needy mistress, his fellow professors and his students — at the same time, which jeopardizes his career and marriage. Buzykin is unlikely to escape his troubles unscathed, but he’s game.

277: In Korea Town LA, Kengo believes he’s the son of God (it’s what his mother told him since he was a young boy). He spends his days working a dead-end job and figuring out his complex feelings for his girlfriend until he sees a one-eared man who could be his father and decides to follow him.

29519: A man, disillusioned by life, has his spirits lifted when he spends a night of intimacy with a friend. Things get complicated when she disappears the next day.

31196: Helen is married to a Kenneth, a honest lawyer whose integrity has always held him back professionally. Hoping to help Kenneth get ahead, Helen confesses to a murder she obviously didn’t commit, confident that he’ll get her off and make his reputation.

49248: Forced to move to Scotland after his father lands a new job, 9-year-old Tony Thompson’s life takes a surprising turn when he’s befriended by an aristocratic vegetarian vampire named Rudolph.

90643: About Sado-masochism, suicide and the irrational nature of the human spirit.

75476: In a futuristic world where Earth is divided into four warring “Corporations,” a frightening new breed of NecroMutant threatens to destroy the global population.

17376: Change comes slowly to a small New Hampshire town in the early 20th century. People grow up, get married, live, and die. Milk and the newspaper get delivered every morning, and nobody locks their front doors.

28627: Sadik, aka Janjan, is the village idiot loved by everyone. His protector, an old man called Murtaza, marries a young woman Guzel. When Murtaza hears rumors about Janjan and Guzel, he kicks Janjan out.

57634: In this loose remake of a 1952 noir classic, Carol Hunnicut experiences the worst blind date imaginable when mob thugs slay her companion. Realizing she’s the lone witness to the crime, Carol flees to a remote mountain home to hide.

35134: While working at the local video store, Vicky meets Sam, who quickly becomes a regular costumer. Both fall in love, ignoring the true reason for their rendez-vous.

130616: The French philosopher and film theorist Gilles Deleuze famously divided cinema into two categories: action-image and time-image. Californian filmmaker and CalArts film lecturer Thom Andersen turns Deleuze’s writing into a template for his latest film essay.
The Thoughts That Once We Had

3688: Inspired by the infamous 1971 robbery that took place at the Lloyds Bank in Marylebone London, this highly-charged heist thriller tautly interweaves high-level corruption, murder and sexual scandal in 1970s England.

93448: Kate and Charlie are a young married couple whose bond is built on a mutual love of music, laughter and… drinking. When Kate decides to get sober, her new lifestyle brings troubling issues to the surface and calls into question her relationship with Charlie.

37165: A shy greeting card store employee unknowingly falls for a lesbian space alien while two government agents closely track their romance.
Codependent Lesbian Space Alien Seeks Same

29801: A chronicle of the lives of several teenagers who attend a New York high school for students gifted in the performing arts.

89096: A thief sneaks into an office where a banker is asleep. The banker is killed by the thief who robs the safe. Later in a café the police arrest the thief and take him to the morgue where he is confronted with the body of the banker.

110405: The 1986 music video for “Walk This Way” symbolically placed Aerosmith and Run–D.M.C. in a musical duel in neighboring studios before Tyler literally breaks through the wall that separates them. The video then segues to the bands’ joint performance on stage.

43228: You’ll never see politics the same after this raucous documentary. Following his country’s economic meltdown, acerbic Icelandic comedian Jon Gnarr launches his own political party, The Best Party.

21528: Set in an unspecified time in the early ’70s, when the United States has become involved in an unpopular war against Mexico (a clear analogy to the Vietnam war) and the Federal Government has stepped up internal security at the expense of individual freedoms.

23905: In this, the first Matt Helm movie, we see Matt Helm coaxed out of semi-retirement by an attractive ex-partner.

20772: Rediscovery of Venezuelan director Margot Benacerraf’s visually stunning portrait of salt miners and fishermen in a remote corner of the Caribbean.

25892: A story about the intricacies of small town life, centered around the misadventures Miles Roby, manager of the Empire Grill.

22723: Beautiful Audrey is expected to remain with her high-school quarterback boyfriend and become a successful fashion model, but she instead becomes interested in a man of mystery—a man with at least one manslaughter in his past.

121196: In a time of starvation, a survivalist lives off a small plot of land hidden deep in forest. When two women seeking food and shelter discover his farm, he finds his existence threatened.

23579: A down-on-his-luck adult film star sees a chance to make a comeback via a lesbian documentary film-maker, but she is exploiting him to get financial backing for her pet project.

118848: A young New Yorker struggles to take control of his reckless, self-destructive behavior in the face of momentous family challenges.

23861: Two criminal drifters without sympathy get more than they bargained for after kidnapping and holding for ransom the surrogate mother of a powerful and shady man.

26781: A man, apparently on the run, takes shelter in a dilapidated house. Every day, he drills a hole through a wall and looks into one of the rooms, each time seeing a different surreal vision…
A Quiet Week in the House

21830: Allen Ginsberg: the ultimate poet and counter-culture adventurer of the Beat Generation. In his famously confessional, leave-nothing-out style, he recounts the road trips, love affairs and search for liberation that led to his timeless, electrifying masterpiece “Howl.”

22647: Kyung-soo romances needy dance instructor Myung-suk (Ye Ji-won), retreats, romances sheltered housewife Sun-young (Chu Sang-mi), and finally retreats. Indeed, the film tackles how we absorb art and experience.
On the Occasion of Remembering the Turning Gate

9544: Construction worker Doug Kinney finds that the pressures of his working life, combined with his duties to his family leaves him with little time for himself. However, he is approached by geneticist Dr. Owen Leeds who offers him a rather unusual solution to his problems – cloning.

78477: As she struggles to complete her new horror novel, best-selling author Tsui Ting-Yin’s gruesome literary creations come to life and ensnare her in their terrifying and all-too-real alternate world.

25626: Three actors learn that their respective performances in the film “Home for Purim,” a drama set in the mid-1940s American South, are generating award-season buzz.

22997: Unable to cope with a recent personal tragedy, LA’s top celebrity shrink turns into a pothead with no concern for his appearance and a creeping sense of his inability to help his patients.

27677: Melvin is a social misfit and is always suffering the abuse of two bullies and their respective girlfriends and the four are also murderers.

45177: An African immigrant to France struggles to find work, facing racism and discrimination.

24800: Phenomena, completed in 1965, moved Belson closer to the totally personal metaphysical experience that culminated two years later in Samadhi.

99784: The first feature film by notorious Canadian musician and performance artist Peaches is a wild transsexual rock opera, screening in conjunction with a new installation and a night of performances.

25742: This musical documentary follows British rock group The Cure through their performance at the classic Theater Antique D’Orange in the French countryside.

26935: On the windswept and sea battered Breton coast two young sailors make their livelihood collecting seaweed, on an offshore island they burn the seaweed to harness its chemicals.

38051: One last trip down the rabbit hole before it gets paved over. A deep geography. What is above and what is below. What came before and what will come after. Agrarian fantasies, sacrificial rites, and excavations.

24518: A U.S. Navy pilot, Neil Smith, is caught in a mysterious storm of butterflies and crash-lands his plane whilst flying over a remote part of Korea. He is found by local villagers who nurse him back to health. Within the small village (Dongmakgol), time appears to stand still.

21684: War hero Dennis Morgan becomes the object of a publicity stunt staged by magazine publisher Sidney Greenstreet.

26549: Walter Faber has survived a crash with an airplane. His next trip is by ship. On board this ship he meets the enchanting Sabeth and they have a passionate love affair. Together they travel to her home in Greece, but the rational Faber doesn’t know what fate has in mind for him for past doings.

43184: Since can-can dancing is forbidden by law in Paris, a French lawyer tries to get an old judge friend to keep the police of his back, while he keeps the show running, but somewhere along the line he falls for the lead dancer.

44249: A college student is thrust into an epic battle of good and evil when he discovers an alien device that transforms him into a fighting machine known as “The Guyver.”

27713: An account of the musical journey and ongoing legacy of Joy Division, the influential Manchester post-punk rock band of the late 1970s. Features interviews with the surviving band members (now known as New Order) and never-before-seen live performance footage and newly discovered audio tapes.

45897: A young woman, after witnessing her parents’ murder as a child in Bogota, grows up to be a stone-cold assassin.

46784: After her boyfriend ends their relationship, the dreamself of a heartbroken woman floats through the air over an industrial wasteland singing ballads of love.
Industrial Symphony No. 1: The Dream of the Brokenhearted

23349: In a poor district of Tokyo, Kochiyama Soshun is leader of a yazuka gang and earns money by betting while his wife, Oshizu, runs a tavern. Although often embroiled in fights, duels and shady deals, Soshun is someone who does not think twice about sacrificing himself for others.

24084: Set in the 1920s Depression, a gang of half-witted small-time hoods led by Slim Grissom kidnap heiress Barbara Blandish and Slim proceeds to fall in love with her.

41835: Ismael (Karra Elejalde) is a thief who, as this thriller opens, is robbing the home of a woman painter. When she unexpectedly returns while he is riffling through her possessions, he kills her without a second thought.

43418: A nightclub dancer marries into society and has to contend with her jealous sister-in-law.

39847: Dorival, a man in jail, has only one wish: to take a bath. To achieve his objective, he defies the private, the corporal, the sargeant and, finally, the lieutenant in charge of the prison.
O Dia em Que Dorival Encarou a Guarda

27123: A documentary on perception of the United States’s war with Iraq, with an emphasis on Al Jazeera’s coverage.

81823: Christopher Lee reprises his role as the eerie Lord Summerisle from 1973’s Brit-horror hit The Wicker Man in this thriller that follows two American Christians who’ve come to evangelize a Scottish village with a twisted pagan history.

46854: Brick Davis goes from being a criminal to working for the government.

100443: A research team from an electronics company move into an old Victorian house to start work on finding a new recording medium.

9210: Boxcar Bertha links up with union organizer “Big” Bill Shelly after the death of her father. Running afoul of anti-union forces, Bertha and Bill  are forced into a life of crime.

119296: The Woman in Black 2: Angel of Death

25172: Dracula is alive. In fact, he plans to rule the world and that is why he seeks the help of other legendary monsters. However, a bunch of kids regarded by their peers as losers uncover the devious plan and prepare for a counter strike.

45747: Two single adults become caregivers to an orphaned girl when their mutual best friends die in an accident.

27047: A magical musical comedy which centers on the reticent and reclusive, Laura Hoff (played by Jane Horrocks), who lives with her mother (Brenda Blethyn) in a small English seaside town.

25016: Three shadow puppets hilariously narrate the Hindu epic “The Ramayana” and its story of the goddess Sita separated from her lord Rama, along with director Nina Paley’s own tale of being dumped by email when her husband moves to India.

44961: A comic artist and an unemployed sex columnist are trying to work together in order to win a lucrative comic-book competition.

10443: Lieutenant Ellen Ripley awakens on a prison planet after her escape pod crashes there, only to discover that her craft has also been harboring a dangerous extra-terrestrial which soon begins a vicious killing spree.

109628: The video also satirized Robert Palmer videos, having three little girls dressed like the three women who play backup guitars in his videos (black dresses, red lipstick, white makeup, and hair tied in buns).

523: When his partner is killed by gangsters, a tough investigator must team up with an undercover cop to seek revenge for his slain partner and bring a dangerous crime syndicate to justice.

110199: Sebastián, 17, manages his uncle’s cosy rent-by-the-hour motel on the coast of Veracruz. Miranda, 35, occasionally meets her lover in the Motel, but he often arrives late. During that spare time, Sebastián and Miranda will become closer and closer.

33943: Doc McCoy is put in prison because his partners chickened out and flew off without him after exchanging a prisoner with a lot of money.

52034: There’s no love lost between undefeated middleweight fighter Kelly Robinson and CIA superstar Alex Scott — a mismatched pair who are teamed up by the government to track down a missing stealth bomber in this action-comedy.

34922: A myth about lost harmony, which is always with us, though we often cannot feel it, is further developed in this film by Alexander Sokurov.

15473: Apartment building superintendent Cleveland Heep rescues what he thinks is a young woman from the complex swimming pool he maintains, when he discovers that she’s actually a character from a bedtime story who is trying to make the journey back to her home.

114297: After receiving a bizarre series of encrypted messages, a group of kids embark on an adventure with an alien who needs their help.

49804: Yabba-dabba-doo! Digital dinosaurs rule the day when Fred, Barney, Betty and Wilma take Vegas by storm in this prequel that posits their lives before marriage.
The Flintstones in Viva Rock Vegas

102825: A look at the relationship between filmmaker Alfred Hitchcock and actress Tippi Hedren.

18845: A concert film featuring four major African American comedians: Steve Harvey, D.L. Hughley, Cedric the Entertainer, Bernie Mac.

25139: Set in a Japanese village, controlled by the eldest branch of the family who own the only clock. Sutekichi lives with his cousin Sue, who wears a chastity belt because sex is forbidden between cousins. This makes Sutekichi a laughing stock, until in rage he murders Daisaku…

46507: A sheltered girl marries a man she meets in Algeria and they are idyllically happy until she finds he is a Trappist monk who has deserted his calling. She persuades him to return to his monastery.

14706: The story of the tragic life of a self destructive female rock star, modeled after Janis Joplin.

97979: Fishing with John: Episode 6 - Thailand with Dennis Hopper, Part II

2825: Jaffa’s Ajami neighborhood is a melting pot of cultures and views among Jews, Muslims and Christians, with fear and love crossing all barriers in this ensemble piece.

27550: A Home at the End of the World

45334: Drama in the life of fisherfolk in a tiny village.

97786: An homage to Kenneth Angers Hollywood Babylon, shot at the Museum of Death, Ca.

108282: The video which accompanied the single was filmed at London’s Brixton Academy on 17 August 1990.

All the Vermeers in New York
